title: Workshop on Designing Digital-Based Self-Regulated Mathematics Vocabulary and Formula Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level background in mathematical theories (geometry, algebra, statistics) and formula application skills, with practical experience using digital tools
context.additional_context: Practical course for pre-service teachers to combine digital tools (interactive simulations, virtual manipulatives) with self-regulated learning strategies when acquiring math terminology. Ensures smartphone-based accessibility; learning data is analyzed for mathematical concept comprehension (equation solving, graph analysis, statistical interpretation) and problem-solving abilities.

learning_goals: Learners can reproduce definitions, formulaic expressions, and graph interpretations of 50 math-specific terms (geometry, algebra, statistics) with ≥90% accuracy using digital flashcards and video-enhanced materials.

Learners can plan, execute, and evaluate math vocabulary learning processes with ≥80% engagement using self-regulated learning strategies (SRLM), deepening conceptual understanding of equations and statistical reasoning through error analysis.

Learners can reflect differentiated strategies for applying digital learning tools (interactive graphs, virtual manipulatives) based on pre-existing vocabulary knowledge (PVK) in project deliverables (mathematical modeling cases and proof processes).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
